thread.title_full: Watch Cate Blanchett Lip-Synch Adele’s “Hello” in a Pussy Hat | Vanity Fair

author: Josh Duboff
title: Watch Cate Blanchett Lip-Synch Adele’s “Hello” in a Pussy Hat | Vanity Fair
text: Watch Cate Blanchett Lip-Synch Adele’s “Hello” in a Pussy Hat And “You Don’t Own Me,” too. by View on Instagram Cate Blanchett —currently in New York starring in The Present —was the headliner Monday night at a one-night-only Stonewall Inn benefit. And if you were present (sorry) at the event, you got some A+ Cate, as the actress lip-synched several numbers and, watching the clips from the night, it’s all pretty fever-dream, “Wait, this actually happened?” Outfitted in a stylish black jacket, accessorized with some dramatic red lipstick, Blanchett performed Dusty Springfield’s “You Don’t Own Me” (in some staggering earrings), giving it a high-drama treatment that surely has already been mimicked by at least 50 vloggers in tribute videos since. At a different point in the evening, Blanchett and assorted others performed Adele’s “Hello.” For that one, she donned one of the knit pink “pussy hats” created around the Women’s March. Loading View on Instagram Cate Blanchett’s life just seems impossibly fun, no? She always seems as if she is having a ball, not taking anything too seriously, while at the same time exuding extreme elegance and intelligence. Anyway, bookmark these clips for the next time you need a jolt of “Oh, yes! Life does have a few wonders embedded within it!” 1 / 19 Reigning Cate April 1998: From left, Joaquin Phoenix, Vince Vaughn, Natalie Portman, Djimon Hounsou, Cate Blanchett, Tobey Maguire, Claire Forlani, Gretchen Mol, Christina Ricci, Ed Furlong, and Rufus Sewell. Photograph by Annie Leibovitz; styled by Nicoletta Santoro. March 1999. Photograph by Annie Leibovitz; styled by Nicoletta Santoro. March 1999: Blanchett relaxes near Palm Springs, California. Photograph by Annie Leibovitz; styled by Nicoletta Santoro. March 1999: A regal Cate. Photograph by Annie Leibovitz; styled by Nicoletta Santoro. February 2009. Photograph by Annie Leibovitz; styled by Michael Roberts. February 2009. Photograph by Annie Leibovitz; styled by Michael Roberts. February 2009.
